intro: Matelea pleistantha, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and climbing plants. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow to orange in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Matelea pleistantha thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded or semi-shaded areas.
